title: AI Team Lead
description:
**Requirements and responsibilities**

**About the Role**
==================


As the AI Development Team Lead, you will spearhead the design, development, and deployment of cutting\-edge AI solutions that revolutionize aviation operations. Working alongside the AI Product Manager and reporting to the CTO, you'll lead a high\-performing team of AI engineers and data scientists to build scalable, impactful AI products. Your role is crucial in transforming complex aviation challenges into intelligent, automated, and efficient solutions.


This position bridges the gap between AI innovation and aviation operational realities—where deep technical expertise meets domain\-driven impact.

### **Key Responsibilities**

**Technical Leadership**


Lead the end\-to\-end development of AI models and intelligent systems tailored to aviation use cases (e.g., MRO, baggage systems, airport ops, CAMO).


Architect and oversee scalable AI infrastructure and pipelines for model training, validation, deployment, and monitoring.


Evaluate and adopt appropriate AI/ML frameworks, tools, and methodologies to ensure state\-of\-the\-art capabilities.

**Team Management**


Manage and mentor a cross\-functional AI team, providing technical guidance, conducting code reviews, and ensuring high engineering standards.


Foster a collaborative and innovation\-driven culture focused on delivery and continuous improvement.

**Cross\-functional Collaboration**


Work closely with the AI Product Manager to translate product vision and aviation pain points into concrete technical requirements and deliverables.


Collaborate with aviation domain experts, software engineers, and stakeholders to ensure AI solutions are operationally viable and commercially valuable.

**Project Delivery**


Own timelines and deliverables for AI development milestones across the product lifecycle—from R\&D and prototyping to pilot programs and commercial launches.


Ensure technical documentation and compliance with aviation and data governance standards.

**Innovation \& Continuous Learning**


Stay ahead of AI trends, with a particular focus on technologies applicable to aviation operations, such as predictive maintenance, computer vision, and intelligent automation.


Contribute to a culture of experimentation and data\-driven decision\-making.

### **About You**

**Experience:** 5\+ years of experience leading AI/ML development teams, with a proven track record of building and deploying AI solutions in production environments.

**Domain Expertise:** Ideally, direct experience or strong interest in the aviation industry (e.g., MRO, CAMO, baggage handling, airport logistics).

**Technical Expertise:**


Proficient in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit\-learn.


Strong background in data pipelines, model ops (MLOps), and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP).


Experience with computer vision, NLP, or time\-series forecasting a plus.

**Leadership:** Demonstrated ability to lead and grow technical teams; excellent stakeholder management and decision\-making skills.

**Communication:** Clear communicator with the ability to engage with both technical and non\-technical stakeholders.

**Innovation:** A passion for pushing the boundaries of AI to solve complex, real\-world problems—especially in highly operational industries.

### **Preferred Qualifications**


Advanced degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or related field.


Previous experience building AI tools/products for commercial use in regulated or mission\-critical sectors.


Familiarity with aviation data standards and integration challenges.


Publications or patents in applied AI fields.


Willingness to travel occasionally for team workshops or client engagements.

### **Why Join Us?**


Be part of a pioneering team shaping the future of aviation through AI.


Work on high\-impact, high\-visibility projects with global relevance.


Collaborate with experts across aviation and emerging tech domains.


Flexible, innovation\-driven work environment

title: Senior AI Engineer
description:
**Requirements and responsibilities**

#### **Duties**

* Lead the design, development, and deployment of advanced AI systems, especially those leveraging Generative AI and LLMs.
* Manage the full lifecycle of AI projects: problem definition, prototyping, deployment, monitoring, and iteration.
* Architect scalable, efficient pipelines for training, fine\-tuning, evaluation, and inference.
* Evaluate and benchmark AI models for performance, alignment, and safety across various business use cases.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams (product managers, engineers, data scientists) to build impactful AI solutions.
* Mentor junior AI engineers and foster a collaborative and innovative technical culture.
* Participate in technical design discussions, system architecture planning, and code reviews.
* Translate business requirements into AI\-driven technical solutions.
* Stay updated on emerging AI/ML trends and assess their practical applicability.

#### **Technical Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field (MS/PhD preferred).
* 5\+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering with production deployment experience.
* Deep expertise in Generative AI (e.g., transformers, LLMs, diffusion models, RAG, prompt engineering).
* Strong coding skills in Python.
* Hands\-on experience with modern AI/ML frameworks: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face, LangChain, LlamaIndex.
* Proficiency with APIs from OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere, etc.
* Experience deploying models at scale using Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems.
* Familiarity with MLOps tools and practices: model versioning, experiment tracking, CI/CD, monitoring.
* Knowledge of real\-time/streaming data frameworks (e.g., Kafka, Spark Streaming) is a plus.
* Experience with one or more domains: Computer Vision, Reinforcement Learning, Multimodal AI, or Knowledge Graphs.
* Research publications in AI/ML journals or conferences (preferred but not required).


**Non\-Technical Requirements:**

* Ability to lead, innovate, and solve open\-ended problems independently.
* Strong communication skills for explaining complex technical concepts to non\-technical stakeholders.
* Comfort operating in ambiguous, fast\-paced environments with minimal supervision.
* Collaborative mindset to work effectively across multiple teams.
* Commitment to fostering a culture of excellence, learning, and innovation.

title: AI Engineer - ML Ops
description:
**Your Impact**
 The primary purpose of this role is to contribute to developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) solutions, supporting a variety of machine learning (ML) models, including deep learning (DL) frameworks and large language models (LLMs). The AI Engineer will apply foundational knowledge to assist in optimizing model performance, developing necessary tools and frameworks, and efficiently managing computing and storage resources. This role will harness AI
   

  

 platform capabilities and help accelerate the development of AI\-driven products.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Develops and maintains AI platform, ensuring the platform meets functional requirements and performance criteria.
* Participates in the lifecycle of AI platform development, including ideation, prototyping, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
* Contributes to the design of scalable and robust infrastructure needed to support AI models in collaboration with infrastructure teams.
* Assists in the integration of AI capabilities into various products and platforms, ensuring smooth transitions and functionality.
* Contributes to peer code reviews, learning from senior team members, and adheres to best practices in AI development.
* Keeps relevant with the latest technologies and frameworks in AI, suggesting improvements and updates to existing systems.
* Supports the implementation of security and compliance measures within the AI development process, aligning with company policies and industry


 regulations.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in science, technology, engineering, math, or relevant field (or equivalent work experience in lieu of degree)
* 2 years of experience executing and deploying data science, ML, and DL (fewer years may be accepted with a Master's or Doctorate degree)
* 1 year of programming language experience
* 1 year of experience working with ML Operations tools


**Preferred Skills/Education**
* Master's Degree in science, technology, engineering, math, statistics, physics, economics, data science, information science, or quantitative analytics
* 1 year of experience working with cross\-functional partners
* 1 year of experience in SQL and NoSQL databases, Hadoop ecosystem, Druid, Big Query, Google Vertex AI, and Python.


**About Lowe’s**
 Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 16 million customer transactions a week in the United States. With total fiscal year 2024 sales of more than $83 billion, Lowe’s operates over 1,700 home improvement stores and employs approximately 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe’s supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing,
   

  

 improving community spaces, helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts and providing disaster relief to communities in need. For more
   

  

 information, visit Lowes.com.
   

  

*Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.*
 Pay Range: $86,600\.00 \- $164,500\.00 annually Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.

title: Generative AI Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 Join our innovative team as a Generative AI Engineer, where you'll design and maintain cutting\-edge data pipelines to fuel actionable insights. You'll collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to enhance operational efficiency and elevate customer satisfaction through advanced data engineering and AI\-driven solutions. This remote role offers the opportunity to make a meaningful impact in a dynamic, fast\-paced environment.
   

  

**Job Title: Generative AI Engineer**
**Location: Remote (US\-based, excluding CA and HI) \- must work EST hours**
**Employment Type: Contract\-to\-Hire**
**Pay Rate: $45\-47/hour (target)**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Data Pipeline Development: Build and maintain robust ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) pipelines to process data from diverse sources, including CRM and call center systems, ensuring seamless integration into data warehouses and lakes
* Data Modeling: Create dimensional and analytical data models to support business reporting and analytics needs, accurately reflecting business domains
* Data Integration: Automate data ingestion and transformation processes, resolving inconsistencies to ensure data integrity across multiple sources
* Data Quality Assurance: Implement checks to monitor and maintain data accuracy and completeness, proactively addressing quality issues
* Performance Optimization: Enhance data pipelines and queries for efficient processing, ensuring timely delivery of insights
* Collaboration: Partner with data analysts, business stakeholders, and data science teams to translate business needs into technical solutions, supporting advanced analytics and machine learning initiatives


**Qualifications**
* Experience: 3\-5 years in data engineering, with strong expertise in ETL processes, data warehousing, and contact center AI/ML applications
* Technical Skills:
* Proficiency in SQL, Python (for ETL, data integration, and modeling), and Java
* Expertise with data integration tools (e.g., Informatica, Talend, or Apache Airflow)
* Strong knowledge of relational and NoSQL databases, cloud platforms (AWS or Google Cloud), and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark)
* Experience with data manipulation tools (e.g., Pandas) and version control systems
* Familiarity with AI/ML fundamentals, model deployment, and data preparation
* Industry Knowledge: Understanding of data privacy, regulatory compliance, and customer feedback measurement in AI projects
* Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field

title: AI Engineer - Machine Learning 2
description:
**Payrate:**

 $78\.00 \- $82\.00/hr.
   


  
   

**Summary:**

 Our team seeks a Machine Learning Engineer to advance the development and improvement of our software foundation and tools vital for training state\-of\-the\-art AI models. Your role will be centered on creating strong, scalable, and efficient training infrastructures and frameworks facilitating the full spectrum of the machine learning process, from handling data to deploying models. In collaboration with researchers and software engineers, you'll ensure that training systems are smoothly integrated and functioning, expanding the limits of AI's capabilities, especially in practical robotics scenarios. Additionally, you will investigate innovative methods to effectively utilize diverse datasets within our training framework.
   


  
   

**Responsibilities:**

* Create and uphold efficient, scalable, and distributed training systems\—including data preprocessing, training orchestration, and model assessment\—for training large\-scale AI models.
* Enhance the efficiency of training procedures to improve performance and use of resources, while maintaining scalability and dependability.
* Collaborate with researchers to create training and evaluation pipelines for state\-of\-the\-art algorithms.
* Develop and design benchmarks for evaluating ML models.
* Perform training and fine\-tuning of foundation models for robotic applications.
* Monitor and analyze pipelines, identifying bottlenecks and proposing solutions to improve efficiency and performance.
* Ensure the robustness and reliability of the training infrastructure, including automated testing and continuous integration.



  
   

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* BS, MS or higher degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Proficiency in Python, C\+\+, or similar and at least one deep learning library such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, etc.
* Strong background in distributed computing, parallel processing techniques, handling large\-scale datasets and data preprocessing.
* Deep understanding of state\-of\-the\-art machine learning techniques and models.
* Experience with cloud\-based training environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
* Experience in developing and maintaining software tooling and infrastructure for machine learning.
* Deep understanding and practical experience with software engineering principles, including algorithms, data structures, and system design.
* Experience with continuous integration and automated testing frameworks.



  
   

**Desired Skills:**

* Minimum 2\+ years experience with Linux
* Minimum 2\+years experience with Python
* Minimum 2\+years experience with Configuration management.
* 2\+ ROS/ROS2
* 2\+ TensorFlow
* 2\+ Any sort of machine learning packages.



  
   

**Pay Transparency:**
*The typical base pay for this role across the U.S. is:*

***$78\.00 \- $82\.00***
***/hr***
*. Final offer amounts, within the base pay set forth above, are determined by factors including your relevant skills, education and experience and the benefits package you select. Full\-time employees are eligible to select from different benefits packages. Packages may include medical, dental, and vision benefits, 10 paid days off, 401(k) plan participation, commuter benefits and life and disability insurance.*

  
   

*For information about our collection, use, and disclosure of applicant's personal information as well as applicants' rights over their personal information, please see our Privacy Policy (https://www.aditiconsulting.com/privacy\-policy).*
  
   

*Aditi Consulting LLC uses AI technology to engage candidates during the sourcing process.  AI technology is used to gather data only and does not replace human\-based decision making in employment decisions.  By applying for this position, you agree to Aditi’s use of AI technology, including calls from an AI Voice Recruiter.*
  
   

*\#AditiConsulting*

**\# 25\-20504**

title: AI Engineer
description:
At Comulate, we’re transforming the insurance back office with AI. Our platform, which reinvents expensive and time\-consuming accounting processes, is the first step in our vision to unlock the hundreds of billions of dollars spent on manual insurance operations.
   

  

 Our Series B, announced in early 2025, led by BOND \& Workday, comes on the heels of record growth and accelerating expansion plans.
   

  

 Why you should consider joining
   

  

* Record\-setting growth, having gone from zero to 8\-figure ARR within three years of founding, representing 95th\+ percentile company growth among startups that achieve these milestones
* Strong product market fit revealed in growth and through customer love, with users describing the platform as “the best thing since sliced bread” and "life\-changing"
* Our lean, talented team is creating category\-defining products for large public and private enterprises, driving 7\-figure ROI and cash\-flow positive operations, providing the best of both worlds: outsized employee ownership and low company risk
* We're continuing to take big, ambitious first\-to\-market bets for a highly committed customer base and an exciting pipeline of new customers
* We’re in the early innings of our vision and poised to take advantage of the massive opportunity to deploy AI into core workflows throughout the insurance industry


**About The Role**
 Insurance is buried in unstructured data across documents, emails, and disparate systems. LLMs have turned this into an opportunity. We’re hiring an
 **AI Engineer** 
 to seize it by building game\-changing products.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

* 4\+ years of experience in software engineering or data science / engineering
* Deep understanding of LLM best practices across evals, RAG, fine\-tuning, and observability
* Familiarity with AI frameworks (e.g. LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar)
* Experience releasing and maintaining production systems
* Proficiency with SQL and relational databases
* Comfortable with handling ambiguity and working in a self\-directed manner
* Curiosity about different industries and the data \+ business context within them


**Projects you might work on**
* Copilot agent to augment \+ automate natural language\-based workflows
* System to extract structured data from millions of complex, varied documents (see our early work on this here)
* Leveraging the latest advancements in browser agents to generically automate repetitive tasks for users


*For more details, see* 
*this article* 
*encapsulating the role of an AI engineer.*
 Our team \& philosophy
   

  

 We’re backed by BOND, Spark Capital, Neo, and Workday, as well as founders/executives from Brex, Asana, Plaid, Applied Intuition, Coalition, and more.
   

  

 Our team hails from companies like Airbnb, Google, Brex, and LiveRamp and we’re fairly low\-profile: focusing the majority of our energy on delivering for customers and building a category\-defining company.
   

  

 We’re hiring predominantly in San Francisco 🌁, as we believe in\-person collaboration is strategically important for a company at our stage — both for velocity and company culture.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Competitive base salary and generous equity
* Generous medical, dental, and vision benefits
* 401K plan enrollment
* Flexible time\-off policy
* Lunch \& dinner every day
* Paid parental leave
* Company outings and offsites
* (and more benefits as we grow!)


*Comulate is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics.*
 Compensation Range: $160K \- $220K

title: AI Engineer
description:
**🚀 About Nava Benefits**
 Nava Benefits is one of the fastest growing benefits brokerages in America and the first to fuse cutting edge technology with benefits expertise to deliver an end to end benefits solution for growing businesses. Through better renewal strategy, benefits back\-office support, and a modern member experience, employers turn to Nava to lower costs, delight employees, and augment HR teams. Nava is driven by the mission to fix healthcare in America, starting with the 160M Americans who get their healthcare through employers. Backed by leading investors and founded by seasoned entrepreneurs, we're an ambitious group of people transforming the $50B / year benefits brokerage industry, and making a positive impact on the lives of Americans across the country.
   

  

**Role Overview** 
 : As an AI Engineer at Nava, you will own execution of AI technology across our application stack in collaboration with the Product team. Your deep understanding of how to leverage foundation models will position you to work across the full stack \- from user interfaces to backend systems \- building intelligent software that transforms how HR teams and employees interact with benefits and healthcare systems, as well as empowering our internal consulting teams who work with these complex systems on behalf of clients. At Nava, we believe AI capabilities should be woven throughout the user experience, not bolted on as separate services. You'll build AI as core application features using direct API integration with foundation models, modern web frameworks, and scalable cloud infrastructure.
   

  

**🧠 Key Responsibilities:** 
  

  

* 
+ Work with product, engineering, and design to identify customer and team pain points and build generative AI solutions using software engineering best practices
+ Work across the full stack \- frontend, backend, and infrastructure \- integrating AI capabilities directly into applications
+ Build intelligent search and retrieval systems that help users find relevant information quickly
+ Design effective interactions with foundation models (GPT\-4, Claude, Gemini) to achieve reliable behaviors
+ Ship AI\-powered features with the same reliability and performance standards as any other application components


**🖊️ Preferred Experience:**
* 5\+ years developing modern full\-stack web applications on client\- and server\- side web applications with Python and JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Hands\-on experience building applications with foundation models through direct API integration
* Proven ability to work with product, engineering, and design teams to identify user problems and translate them into technical solutions, leading the initiative for how to build delightful AI (generative) solutions
* Comfortable working across the full application stack
* Strong communication skills for working with cross\-functional teams that are not on the technology side of the business
* An understanding of how to use tool calling, multi agents, etc. and some excitement about MCPs
* Working experience with Machine Learning (PyTorch, scikit\-learn), training/deploying models with proprietary or Open Source models


**☄️ Our Tech Stack:** 
  

  

* 
+ Frontend: React / Vite / Next.js
+ Backend: Node / Nest.js / Express.js
+ API: REST / Graphql
+ AI: OpenAI / Anthropic / different AI platforms, Langfuse
+ Database: Postgres
+ Data Platforms: Salesforce, Airbyte, Dagster, Parabola, DBT
+ Infrastructure: AWS
+ Dev AI assistants: GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Claude Code


****🤝** 
 Commitment to Diversity \& Inclusion**
 We believe that solving America's healthcare problems requires leveraging our nation's diversity. We are committed to creating an equitable and inclusive work environment and strongly encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants for this engineering position must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full\-time basis with no need for sponsorship now or in the future. We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer who embodies our core values:
 **Own the Outcome, Be a Great Co\-pilot, Drive Progress Through Action,** 
 and
 **Create Super Fans** 
 .
   

  

**🩺 Benefits:**
* Health \& Wellness: Medical insurance, including a $0 premium HDHP plan for individuals, Dental, Vision, Telehealth and Virtual Primary Care Visits, OneMedical membership, Wellhub, and a $50 monthly benefit to improve your mental or physical health.
* Financial Support: Stock options, 401(k) with a $2,000 match, FSA, HSA, and access to Origin Financial.
* Work\-Life: Flexible PTO, 12 weeks of paid parental leave with 2 weeks of transition time, $50 monthly connectivity reimbursement, and company\-paid short\-term disability, long\-term disability, and life insurance, with additional voluntary benefits like supplemental life, AD\&D, hospital indemnity, accident, and critical illness coverage.
* Professional Support: $1,000 home office setup stipend and access to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

title: AI / ML Engineer
description:
**Who we are:**
 We are a brilliant team making our history to evolve the commerce industry. fabric is the next\-generation commerce platform that is designed to provide the commerce services customers expect so they can build world\-class experiences, anywhere.
   

  

 fabric is on a mission to revolutionize commerce for everyone, and we empower businesses that are striving to deliver commerce that drives conversion and customer outcomes. Leading retailers, including Chico’s, Brooklinen, and Ashley’s Furniture, trust fabric to run their modern commerce business. Headquartered in San Francisco, fabric was founded in 2017 by a group of industry veterans determined to bring the same technical principles found at Amazon to retail.
   

  

 No matter what field you are in, fabric has exciting opportunities for people passionate about making a difference and skilled at what they do!
   

  

 Here are four questions you should ask yourself:
   

  

* Do I believe in fabric's mission?
* Am I eager to build cool things?
* Am I excited to collaborate with brilliant people?
* Am I motivated to disrupt e\-commerce?


 If the answer is yes, we want to talk to you!
   

  

**Where we hire:**
 United States (California, Washington, New York, Texas, Massachusetts)
   

  

**Your next career:**
 At fabric, we're building the future of commerce with AI agents that help merchants make and save more money. We’re looking for an AI Engineer to help design, build, and scale agentic AI platform and agents that power our next generation commerce operating system.
   

  

 You’ll join a small, high\-impact team focused on building agentic and intelligent applications from the ground up working closely with the CPTO as well as Head of AI Engineering. This is a great opportunity for someone excited to work across the full product development lifecycle, in a 0\-1 environment and contribute to shaping the AI foundation at a well funded startup.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities:**
* Contribute to end\-to\-end AI/ML solutions: Help frame problems, design models, train, evaluate, and deploy AI/ML systems into production.
* Develop production\-grade pipelines: Implement pipelines for model training, testing, serving, and monitoring.
* Apply a variety of AI/ML techniques: From classical supervised/unsupervised learning to deep learning and optimization techniques, depending on the problem at hand.
* Help build intelligent data products: Such as recommendation engines, personalization, categorization, search ranking, forecasting, and fraud detection.
* Support MLOps efforts: Participate in maintaining infrastructure and tooling to support rapid experimentation and reliable deployment.
* Collaborate across teams: Work closely with product managers, designers, and software engineers to build AI agents that solve real world problems.
* Stay curious and informed: Explore new tools, libraries, and research to keep improving the quality and performance of our AI systems.


**What you bring to the table:**
* 5\+ years of experience in applied ML/AI roles, ideally within product\-focused environments or high\-growth startups.
* Proven experience building and deploying ML models for real\-world use cases (e.g., recommendations, search, NLP, categorization).
* Full\-stack ML expertise across:
* Data Engineering (feature engineering/ store, distributed data processing).
* Modeling (deep learning, classical ML, RL, unsupervised learning).
* MLOps (deployment, monitoring, CI/CD, infrastructure).
* Product Building \- building end\-end SAAS products.
* Strong programming skills using Spark, Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, MLFlow, Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
* Experience with Knowledge graphs is a big plus.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics/ Statistics, or related field—or equivalent practical experience.
* Passion for building usable, scalable products — not just research or models.
* Clear communicator with a collaborative mindset, eager to grow and contribute within a small, fast\-paced team.


 The base salary for this role is between CAD $135K to 170K annually.
   

  

 The annual base salary range for this full\-time position reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Actual pay may vary, depending on qualifications, experience and location. In addition, this role may be eligible for an annual performance bonus, equity options, and company benefits (your recruiter can share more details during the hiring process). Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed above.
   

  

**What we bring to the table:**
* Competitive compensation packages
* PTO and Holiday plans
* Benefits packages which include Medical, Dental, Life, and Vision
* Wellness \& Technology Programs
* 401k Program
* Fast\-paced, fun and collaborative environment
* A team invested in you both personally and professionally
* fabric is an equal opportunity employer as well as a government contractor that shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60\-300\.5(a), which prohibits discrimination against qualified protected Veterans and the requirements of 41 CFR 60\-741\.5(A), which prohibits discrimination against qualified individuals on the basis of disability.


 \#
 *LI\-Remote*

title: AI Engineer, Post-Training - Helix Team
description:
Figure is an AI Robotics company developing a general purpose humanoid. Our humanoid robot, Figure 02, is designed for commercial tasks and the home. We are based in San Jose, CA and require 5 days/week in\-office collaboration. It’s time to build.
   

  

 Figure’s vision is to deploy autonomous humanoids at a global scale. Our Helix team is looking for an
 **AI Engineer, Post\-Training** 
 to work on enhancing and deploying state\-of\-the\-art AI models. You will focus on improving large pre\-trained models for practical applications, ensuring that they are reliable, efficient, and scalable. You will collaborate closely with research and product teams to develop new techniques for optimizing AI systems, and help integrate advanced AI capabilities into products and services.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead the post\-training research to improve performance, safety, and generalization of large\-scale AI models.
* Work with cross\-functional teams to deploy AI solutions in real\-world applications, focusing on improving the user experience and model performance.
* Develop and implement novel approaches to model fine\-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
* Design and conduct experiments to better understand model behavior and to identify and mitigate risks related to fairness, safety, and reliability.
* Collaborate with other researchers, engineers, and product teams to align model development with company goals.
* Contribute to cutting\-edge research and bring new insights to the team to solve complex problems in AI deployment.


**Requirements**
* Strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing (NLP).
* Proven experience in model development, tuning, and evaluation with large\-scale neural networks.
* Familiarity with AI safety and robustness challenges in real\-world environments.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, with experience in machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
* Experience working with large codebases and distributed computing environments.
* Ability to conduct independent research and collaborate effectively in a team\-oriented environment.
* A Masters or PhD or equivalent experience in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Machine Learning, AI, or related disciplines).


**Bonus Qualifications**
* Prior experience working with robotic learning systems


 The US base salary range for this full\-time position is between $175,000 \- $350,000 annually.
   

  

 The pay offered for this position may vary based on several individual factors, including job\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package may also include additional components/benefits depending on the specific role. This information will be shared if an employment offer is extended.

title: GTM AI Engineer
description:
**About Lindy**
 We're on a mission to free humanity from work. What if your AI teammate could manage your inbox, run your calendar, manage your meetings, communicate with clients, and close deals?
   

  

 As crazy as it sounds, humanity has already freed itself once — from hard, menial work. We’re just finishing the job, using AI agents to automate all knowledge work.
   

  

 Our goal is to build AI employees that can collaborate with humans and other AI employees across all channels (email, Slack, Zoom, phone calls, etc), pursue ambiguous goals in dynamic contexts, and continuously learn from their experience.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a
 **GTM AI Engineer** 
 at Lindy, you will be the hybrid technical sales powerhouse that drives revenue through AI\-powered automation and deep customer expertise.
   

  

 You'll own the entire sales funnel for complex outbound campaigns, combining the roles of SDR and AI Automation Engineer into one technical position.
   

  

 Using Lindy's powerful AI agent platform, you'll do the work of 3\+ traditional sales team members.
   

  

 Read our Culture Doc
   

  

**We are an in\-office company, working from our San Francisco office 4 days a week. We do sponsor visas and cover relocation fees for up to $20,000\.**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Own end\-to\-end sales cycles for enterprise outbound campaigns, from prospecting to close, targeting clients focused on results\-driven sales automation
* Deep ICP research and audience definition before any campaign launches, ensuring messaging precision and campaign success
* Build and iterate on messaging strategies through continuous A/B testing and campaign optimization (expect 3\+ months of constant tinkering per client)
* Execute multi\-channel outbound campaigns across email, LinkedIn, SMS, voice, and more
* Design and build sophisticated AI agent workflows within Lindy that seamlessly integrate with CRMs, marketing automation platforms, and other enterprise systems to create truly autonomous sales operations
* Create agentic workflows that handle complex, multi\-step processes — from initial outreach through qualification, nurturing, and handoffs — providing a white\-glove experience at scale
* Track and optimize for reply rates as the golden metric, managing campaigns sending thousands of messages per month
* Provide technical consultation to enterprise clients on sales automation strategy and implementation, architecting end\-to\-end solutions that transform their GTM operations
* Partner with product teams to influence roadmap based on real customer feedback and GTM needs


**Must\-haves**
* Proven track record in B2B sales with experience owning deals from prospecting to close
* Deep expertise with sales automation tools like Clay, Apollo, Outreach, or similar platforms
* Strong technical aptitude for building complex workflows and troubleshooting automation systems
* Experience with multi\-channel outbound (email, LinkedIn, SMS) and understanding of channel\-specific best practices
* Data\-driven mindset with experience running A/B tests and optimizing campaigns based on metrics
* Exceptional communication skills for both technical implementation and executive\-level client relationships
* High tolerance for iteration and willingness to constantly tinker with messaging and campaigns
* Ability to work in person 4 days a week from our San Francisco office


**Nice\-to\-have**
* Agency or consulting experience in sales automation or GTM
* Engineering background or experience with APIs and technical integrations
* Experience at high\-growth SaaS companies scaling outbound operations
* Background with AI/ML tools and prompt engineering
* RevOps or sales operations experience
* Track record of building processes from 0 to 1


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary and generous equity
* Commission structure aligned with client success and revenue growth
* Health coverage
* Covered in\-office lunch \+ dinner
* A lot of autonomy within your area of responsibility
* Direct impact on product roadmap through customer feedback
* The fun of working at a no\-nonsense startup that just wants to build an amazing product and business

title: Senior Data Scientist / Senior AI Engineer (mwd)
company: HMS Analytical Software | Consulting & End-to-End Solutions for Data Science & Analytics
description:
Unsere über 30\-jährige Erfolgsgeschichte im Software Analytics\-Bereich zeigt: wir sind hochspezialisierte Experten, wenn es darum geht, datengetriebene Geschäftsmodelle zu schaffen. Durch die Synthese von Data Engineering, Machine Learning und Software Engineering unterstützen wir Unternehmen dabei aus ihren Daten Mehrwerte zu generieren. Unsere über 160 Mitarbeiter treiben digitale Modernisierungen in den Branchen Manufacturing, Finance und Life Science voran und bereiten den Weg für eine Wirtschaft, die sich auf Wissen, Technik und Verantwortung stützt.
   

  

**Aufgaben**
* Als Senior Data Scientist / Senior AI Engineer (mwd) wirken Sie u.a. aktiv bei der Digitalisierung von Geschäftsprozessen und Produktionsanlagen durch den Einsatz von Machine Learning und GenAI bei führenden Unternehmen mit.
* Sie analysieren die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden, übersetzen diese in komplexe, analytische Fragestellungen und verzahnen alles eng mit dem Data Engineering und der Informatik.
* Dabei bringen Sie Ihre fachlichen Kompetenzen ein, nutzen Ihr unternehmerisches Denken und entwickeln so unsere strategischen Projekte mit hoher Wirkungsmacht weiter.
* Sie lassen andere an Ihrem Wissen teilhaben – als Mentor für andere Kolleginnen und Kollegen oder in unserem bewährten Kompetenzmanagement.


**Profil**
* Mindestens guter Abschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik bzw. artverwandten Fachrichtungen oder in Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbaren naturwissenschaftlichen Studiengängen
* Mehrjährige Praxiserfahrung in Data Science, Business Intelligence oder Software Engineering im Machine\-Learning\- oder GenAI\-Umfeld oder als Berater im Digitalisierungskontext
* Sehr gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einer analytischen Programmiersprache (z.B. Python, R) oder einer universellen Programmiersprache (z.B. C\#, Java, C\+\+, Rust)
* Gute Kenntnisse in der Nutzung relationaler Datenbanken und SQL
* Fundierte Erfahrungen mit Cloud\-Technologien (z.B. Azure, AWS)
* Erfahrung mit Big\-Data\-Technologien (z.B. Spark, Kafka) sowie Operationalisierungswerkzeugen (z.B. Docker, Kubernetes)
* Erfahrungen in DevOps/MLOps\-Prinzipien und \-Tools
* Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsstärke in Deutsch und Englisch \- im Team und Kunden gegenüber
* Neugier und Bereitschaft zu gelegentlichen Reisen


 Sie haben bei uns vielfältige Möglichkeiten zur Weiterentwicklung und Übernahme von Verantwortung. Sie können mit uns den fachlichen Karriereweg einschlagen, als Projektleitung agieren oder im Management Ihr unternehmerisches Potenzial ausschöpfen: alles unter Wahrung einer gesunden Work\-Life\-Balance!
   

  

**Wir bieten**
**Mensch \& Kultur:** 
 Die Gemeinschaft und der Austausch im Unternehmen werden durch vielfältige Events wie Unternehmensmittagessen, Sommerfeste, Teamevents, Unternehmenskonferenzen und Weihnachtsfeiern aktiv gefördert. Ein Welcome Day sowie ein Mentoren\-Programm während der Einarbeitungszeit tragen zudem dazu bei, den Zusammenhalt innerhalb der Teams zu stärken. Zusätzlich fördern wir den Teamgeist durch eine substanzielle Gewinnbeteiligung, die auf alle Mitarbeiter verteilt wird.
   

  

**Karriereentwicklung \& Wissensaustausch:** 
 Die Vielfalt unserer (Kunden\-)Projekte ermöglicht eine individuelle Karriereentwicklung. Verschiedenste Schulungsangebote und die Teilnahme an Fachkonferenzen fördern fachliches Wachstum. Ein jährliches Wissensbudget von 12 Tagen und Wissenszirkel unterstützen den kontinuierlichen Wissensaustausch.
   

  

**Work\-Life\-Balance \& Flexibilität:** 
 Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Arbeitszeitkonto, Mobile Office/hybrides Arbeiten, Workation\-/Sabbatical\-Optionen und die Möglichkeit Hunde mit ins Büro zu bringen, sind nur ein Teil unseres Angebots für Flexibilität und Lebensqualität. Auch in kritischen Situationen unterstützen wir mit bis zu 5 bezahlten Abwesenheitstagen, um sich um pflegebedürftige oder kranke Familienmitglieder zu kümmern.
   

  

**Finanzielle Vorteile:** 
 Mitarbeiter profitieren von unseren Zuschüssen für: Kinderbetreuung, Essen und Sport, betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit unverbindlicher Beratung, Deutschlandticket für nachhaltiges Reisen.
   

  

**Gesundheit \& Wohlbefinden:** 
 Verschiedene Gesundheitsmaßnahmen wie bewegte Pausen, Ergonomieberatung, Grippeimpfung und Augenarztuntersuchung fördern das Wohlbefinden und die langfristige Gesundheit der Mitarbeiter. Gesunde Snacks und Getränke gehören selbstverständlich ebenfalls zu unserem Angebot. Und um auch die soziale Interaktion zu stärken, haben wir Hobby\- und Sportgruppen etabliert, welche nicht nur den lockeren Austausch, sondern auch den Zusammenhalt im Team stärken.
   

  

**Soziale Verantwortung \& Nachhaltigkeit:** 
 Durch die HuManS\-Stiftung streben wir danach, einen positiven Beitrag zur Gesellschaft zu leisten. Unsere Klimainitiative und das Umweltprogramm setzen sich engagiert für nachhaltige Unternehmenspraktiken ein.
   

  

**Important note**
 Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non\-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.
   

  

 LNKD1\_DE

title: AI Software Engineer
description:
**AI Software Engineer** 




**Location** 
 \- Berlin (Remote first)
 



**Salary \-** 
 95k\-125k
 



  





 Our client is a VC backed B2B SaaS company, on a mission to transform how organizations manage risk and compliance, using cutting\-edge technology and AI to automate and enhance governance workflows. Backed by strong funding and led by a proven team, they’re building a platform that redefines how businesses handle compliance in a digital\-first world.
 



  





 They’re now seeking a talented and driven
 **AI Engineer** 
 to join their team and take the lead on the design and implementation of intelligent systems that drive automation, efficiency, and insight across the platform. The ideal candidate will combine strong software engineering skills with a passion for building practical AI solutions in real\-world environments.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Technical Leadership:** 
 Take ownership of end\-to\-end design and development of AI\-powered features, ensuring performance, observability, and scalability from the outset.
* **Intelligent Systems Development:** 
 Build and refine agent\-like systems, integrating with vector search and document retrieval frameworks to support dynamic, user\-driven workflows.
* **Hands\-On Architecture:** 
 Lead on the architecture, lifecycle, and deployment of AI features, from prototyping through to production and beyond.
* **Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with Product, Engineering, and Design teams to translate requirements into robust, efficient AI features that directly enhance user experience.
* **Operational Excellence:** 
 Champion quality, security, and reliability throughout the AI stack, ensuring all systems comply with internal InfoSec and data privacy requirements.
* **Tooling \& Innovation:** 
 Contribute to the internal toolset that supports AI development velocity and stay abreast of advances in LLMs, vector databases, and agent frameworks — bringing practical ideas into the product.
* **Best Practices:** 
 Drive performance optimization, cost control, robust fallback strategies, and strong test coverage in AI feature design.



  





**Tech Environment** 



* **Languages \& Frameworks:** 
 Python (core AI), TypeScript, LangChain, LlamaIndex
* **Infrastructure \& DevOps:** 
 AWS, Azure OpenAI, Terraform, Temporal
* **Data \& Search:** 
 pgvector, semantic search libraries
* **Application Layer:** 
 NodeJS, GraphQL, monorepo setup



  





**Ideal Candidate Profile** 



* **AI Application Expertise:** 
 Strong experience designing and deploying AI/LLM\-based features in production, ideally in high\-compliance or data\-sensitive industries.
* **Deep Technical Acumen:** 
 Skilled in RAG pipelines, vector search integration, prompt engineering, and constructing advanced LLM\-driven workflows.
* **Well\-Rounded Engineer:** 
 Strong background in both backend development and AI/ML integration, with fluency in Python and TypeScript.
* **Quality\-Focused:** 
 Brings rigor to engineering through TDD, CI/CD, detailed documentation, and clean architecture.
* **Cross\-Functional Communicator:** 
 Able to explain complex systems to non\-technical stakeholders and align technical execution with product goals.
* **Mentorship \& Growth:** 
 Ideally brings experience mentoring others and contributing to the technical direction of teams or projects.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**AI Engineer – Berlin\- 100k Euro**
 Our client, a rapidly growing company in the travel tech space, is seeking a skilled LLM \& Backend Engineer to join their AI Innovation Team based in Berlin. In this role, you’ll work at the forefront of AI and backend engineering, helping build intelligent, conversational travel assistants powered by Large Language Models (LLMs).
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in developing backend infrastructure, designing smart workflows, and delivering real\-time, AI\-driven experiences for travelers worldwide. If you thrive at the intersection of AI, automation, and product innovation\-this is your opportunity to make a real impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities for the AI Engineer include:**
* LLM Integration \& Prompt Engineering: Deploy and optimize LLMs (e.g. GPT\-4, Claude, Mistral) to process natural language travel queries.
* RAG Pipelines: Build Retrieval\-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for improved multi\-turn conversational context.
* Conversational AI Logic: Design dynamic flows to handle complex user needs like booking changes, itinerary updates, and recommendations.
* Backend API Development: Create scalable, secure, asynchronous APIs using FastAPI or Django.
* Database Management: Design and interact with PostgreSQL or MongoDB, using SQLAlchemy or similar ORMs.
* Cloud Infrastructure: Deploy solutions on AWS, GCP, or Azure using serverless (e.g., Lambda) and containerized architectures.
* LLM Fine\-Tuning \& Evaluation: Apply techniques like LoRA and PEFT to fine\-tune models, and evaluate outputs using BLEU, ROUGE, etc.
* NLP Pipeline Development: Implement functionality such as named entity recognition, sentiment analysis, and intent detection.
* Cross\-Team Collaboration: Work closely with AI researchers, frontend developers, and product teams in an agile environment.


**It Is Essential For The AI Engineer To Have**
* 2\+ years in backend development with Python
* 1\+ year working directly with LLMs, NLP systems, or conversational AI
* Experience with LangChain, LlamaIndex, Hugging Face Transformers, OpenAI/Anthropic APIs
* Proficient in FastAPI or Django
* Knowledge of PostgreSQL/MongoDB and cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure)
* Understanding of prompt engineering, RAG systems, and LLM fine\-tuning methods
* Strong grasp of NLP concepts and AI product design


**It is not essential but ideal for the AI Engineer to have**
* Experience with serverless or container\-based deployments
* Familiarity with conversational UX and dialogue systems
* Product\-focused mindset and collaborative working style
* Passion for applying emerging AI technologies to real\-world challenges


**Benefits For The Successful Candidate Include**
* Join an innovative AI team at the heart of the travel tech industry
* Work with cutting\-edge LLM technologies in a production environment
* Berlin\-based role with flexible remote options
* Dynamic, cross\-functional team with a strong tech culture
* Competitive compensation and long\-term career growth


 Interviews are now being arranged, please send in your CV for a confidential discussion.
   

  

 Venquis is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

title: Senior AI Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
**Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.**
 At Allianz Global Investors we foster a culture of professionalism, fulfilment, and an inclusive working environment. Do you want to be part of a leading active asset management company? Then join us now!
   

  

 As the Senior AI Software Engineer (f/m/d) in the team, you will be primarily responsible for the design and development of full\-stack Generative AI (GenAI) and Machine Learning (ML) applications for a wide range of use cases in the Asset Management space. This role works closely with domain experts to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements for development.
   

  

 By leveraging Generative AI, you will take a technical leadership role in driving the development of innovative solutions and providing technical guidance to the development team where necessary. Within a central AI team in collaboration with other engineers \& architects, the Sr. AI Software Engineer (f/m/d) leads the development of prototypes to assess technology readiness and suitability for specific applications, ultimately guiding the scaling of the most promising prototypes into production\-ready applications and platforms.
   

  

 A secondary part of the role is to develop AI engineering capability to meet the growing demand for AI. This involves researching new technologies, defining technical standards, rolling out templates, frameworks \& best practices such as LLMOps/MLOps together with its enablement across the organization via developer communities and outreach initiatives.
   

  

 This position will be based in Frankfurt or Munich.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Provide technical leadership by defining and sharing engineering best practices such as MLOps/LLMOps and ensuring company policies/procedures are adhered to for the AI solutions the team manages
* Mentor \& co\-ordinate activities of junior AI engineers
* Development of full\-stack solutions for GenAI/ML applications, integrating both frontend and backend components to deliver robust and scalable solutions
* Work closely with cross\-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate these into technical requirements for application development
* Ideation and development of solutions and co\-creation with development teams to transition prototypes into production where viable
* AI enablement and upskilling within AllianzGI through consultations, training, and communities with engineers, citizen developers, etc.
* Share best practices and content around AI Engineering and AI in general, with the objective of accelerating the adoption of AI across the company
* Champion responsible, secure, and compliant AI
* Work with and make recommendations to leadership teams regarding AI strategy, roadmap, and buy\-versus\-build decisions
* Research and share the latest industry trends and technologies to help foster AllianzGI relevant innovation and business transformation


**What You Bring**
**Education**
* University degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Machine Learning, Data Science or related fields


**Experience**
* A minimum of ten (10\) years’ experience in full stack application development is required
* Ideally industry experience in Investment Banking/Asset Management
* A minimum of three (3\) years’ industry experience in GenAI and ML based App development
* A minimum of three (3\) years’ experience working with agile teams, required


**Knowledge \& Hardskills**
* Proficiency in Python, including experience with libraries and frameworks relevant to ML and GenAI application development (e.g., LangChain, FastAPI, Semantic Kernel, and AutoGen)
* Detailed understanding and hands\-on experience with large language models (LLMs), AI agents, retrieval\-augmented generation (RAG) architecture, embedding techniques, prompt engineering, fine\-tuning, multi\-choice prompts (MCPs), LLMOps, MLOps, vibecoding, and reinforcement learning
* Experience with modern web development frameworks and languages, including React, TypeScript, and Node.js, with a background in building and maintaining both front\-end and back\-end applications
* Experience working with production\-grade vector databases (e.g., Azure AI Search, MongoDB, Cosmos DB, pgvector, Chroma, or Milvus) for efficient storage and retrieval of embeddings
* Ideally experienced with container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and Cloud native services in Azure
* Experience with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL)
* Experience with Agile development and DevOps practices using tools such as Harness, GitHub, JFrog, Jira, and Datadog
* Ability to create unit tests, integration tests using common testing frameworks (e.g., pytest, Playwright)
* Ideally knowledge and strong understanding of component\-based architecture, state management and intuitive UX design principles


**Softskills**
* Well\-developed interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at all organizational levels, coupled with excellent English communication
* Ability to translate and drive conceptual ideas to technical requirements for application development
* Strong analytical skills, and a creative mindset to effectively define problems and explore solutions
* Ability to understand technical problems presented by non\-technical users and communicate technical solutions in a clear, non\-technical manner
* Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with a strong customer\-service focus
* Strong organizational skills to manage time efficiently, prioritize tasks, and meet multiple deadlines


**What We Offer**
* We empower our employees by ensuring flexible work arrangements that maintain a balance between performance, productivity, career development and personal priorities (e.g., hybrid model/ flexible working hours)
* Securing your future: Access to company pension/savings plans
* Family support (relocation/ childcare facilities)
* Company share purchasing plan
* Mental health and wellbeing programs
* Mobility solutions (Jobrad bike leasing, subvention Jobticket)
* Career opportunities within the entire Allianz Group
* Self\-guided learning \& development
* … and so much more!


**About Allianz Global Investors**
 Allianz Global Investors is a leading global active asset manager.
   

  

 We invest for the long term and want to create value for clients every step of the way. We do this by being active – in how we partner with clients and anticipate their needs, and build solutions based on capabilities across public and private markets. Our focus on enhancing our clients’ assets leads naturally to a commitment to sustainability for positive change. Our goal is to enhance the investment experience for clients, whatever their location or goals.
   

  

 Putting our clients' needs first, behaving in a transparent way and treating people fairly means acting with integrity. We encourage a collegial culture, that supports individual responsibility. We invest in the development of our employees to maximize the power of innovation.
   

  

 We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce, we are committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to helping applicants with any disabilities. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board.
   

  

 If you feel inspired to promote the active asset management experience, this is the place for you. Join our diverse, international, technology\-enabled, and agile environment. Simply upload your CV in English to apply for this position! If you need support to navigate our websites or at any stage during your application, please send an email with your request to recruiting@allianzgi.com
   

  

**To Recruitment Agencies** 
 :
   

  

 Allianz Global Investors has an in\-house recruitment team that sources great candidates directly. Therefore, Allianz Global Investors does not accept unsolicited resumes from agency or search firm recruiters.
   

  

 When we do work with recruitment agencies, that engagement is formalized by a contract. Fees will only be paid when there is a contract in place.
   

  

 Without a contract in place, we will not accept invoices on unsolicited resumes, even if the candidate was ultimately employed by Allianz Global Investors.
   

  

 Finally, please do not contact hiring managers directly.
   

  

 76875 \| IT \& Tech Engineering \| Professional \| n.a. \| Allianz Global Investors \| Full\-Time \| Permanent

title: Senior AI Engineer Team Lead
description:
**Our Mission** 




  





 abaut is an emerging Munich\-based B2B SaaS startup within the construction industry. Our mission is to provide companies along the construction value chain with easy and fast access to digital technologies, foremost among them machine data analysis using artificial intelligence. Our solution is already in use on construction sites and in businesses throughout Europe. The construction industry is undergoing digital transformation. Do you want to make a real difference and help shape this transformation and the future of the digital construction site in an innovative startup? Do you enjoy working independently in a small, young team? Then we're looking for you!
 



  





**The Position** 




  





 We are seeking a dedicated Team Lead backend developer to join our team and help us build and enhance our software platform. In this role, you will be responsible for guiding a small team of developers for classification, data management, interaction between components, etc.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities** 




  




* Learn and understand our backend system with its various components and interactions
* Guide a small team of developers
* Manage the development projects, such as understand requirements, describe technical specification, control development, test the resulting software
* Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members
* Ensure the security, scalability, and performance of our applications



  





**Your Profile** 




  




* A Master's degree in Computer Science or similar
* Proven experience as a software developer
* Experience in modern IT technologies, such as Python, Bash scripts, Docker, git, Visual Studio Code, …
* Familiarity with cloud technologies and containerization tools like Docker
* Strong problem\-solving skills and attention to detail
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities



  





**We Offer** 




  





 From the outset, we embody pioneering spirit and traction. abaut GmbH offers its employees a modern working environment, providing deep insights into the workings of a young high\-tech company. We offer home office, above\-average social benefits, and an excellent environment for your personal development, with the best chances for a leadership position in the near future.
 



  





 If you feel addressed, please send us your application and CV.

title: Senior Machine Learning / AI Engineer (all genders)
description:
Wir gehören zu den Top\-Adressen in der IT\-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngeschäfts­prozesse unserer Kunden. Durch den smarten Einsatz maßgeschneiderter IT\-Lösungen unterstützen wir unsere Kunden dabei, das Beste aus ihrem Business und aktuellen Technologien herauszuholen. Unseren Erfolg aber erreichen wir nur durch eins: die Menschen bei adesso! Sie bringen Ideen, fachliches Know how und Technologien zusammen. Gemeinsam programmieren wir (deine) Zukunft bei adesso.
   

  

**DEINE ROLLE**
* Konzeption und Implementierung: Du konzipierst und implementierst innovative AI\-Lösungen für unterschiedliche Branchen mit starkem Fokus auf Cloud\-Infrastrukturen.
* Optimierung und Automatisierung: Du unterstützt uns bei der Optimierung und Automatisierung bestehender AI\-Lösungen und sorgst damit für eine kontinuierliche Verbesserung der AI\-Produkte unserer Kunden.
* ML\-Modelle und Beratung: Du automatisierst Trainings\- und Release\-Prozesse von ML\-Modellen und berätst unsere Kunden bei der Auswahl und Implementierung moderner AI\-Plattformen und \-Frameworks.
* AI Use Cases und Geschäftsmodelle: Du unterstützt uns und unsere Kunden bei der Identifizierung und Umsetzung von innovativen AI Use Cases sowie bei der Entwicklung von neuen datengetriebenen Geschäftsmodellen.
* Teamarbeit und Weiterentwicklung: Du arbeitest gerne gemeinsam im Team beständig an der Weiterentwicklung unserer AI\-Lösungen und bist dabei technologisch stets auf dem neuesten Stand.


**DEIN PROFIL**
* Akademischer Hintergrund: Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in der Fachrichtung Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder ein vergleichbares Studium mit relevantem Bezug
* Berufserfahrung: Mindestens zwei Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung mit ausgeprägtem ML\-Hintergrund und Erfahrung in der Erstellung, Bereitstellung und Pflege von ML\-Modellen in der Produktion
* Technische Fähigkeiten: Fortgeschrittene Kenntnisse in Python und den gängigen Machine Learning\-Bibliotheken sowie Erfahrungen mit MLOps\-Tools wie MLflow, KubeFlow o.ä.
* Zusatzkenntnisse: Von Vorteil sind Erfahrungen im Umgang mit großen Datenmengen sowie im Einsatz von Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, ARM).
* Teamfähigkeit und Innovationsfreude: Spaß an der Arbeit in einem agilen Team, "Out of the box"\-Denken und hohes Interesse daran, sich mit neuen Themen auseinanderzusetzen
* Sprachkenntnisse: Sehr gute Deutsch\- und gute Englischkenntnisse


 Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlfühlen! Kollegial, familiär und auf Augenhöhe – wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Diversität und verschiedene Blickwinkel werden bei uns genauso geschätzt wie du als Mensch. Das und viel mehr steht für unser ganz besonderes Wir\-Gefühl. Für das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi.
   

  

 Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind geprägt von gegenseitiger Wertschätzung, Anerkennung und Unterstützung. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home\-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1\. Platz beim Wettbewerb „Deutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK“!. Unser umfangreiches Trainingsangebot und ein transparentes Laufbahnstufenmodell für alle sorgen dafür, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht stillsteht. Denn gemeinsam zu wachsen und Chancengeber zu sein, das ist programmiert in unserer DNA.

title: AI Engineer
description:
Estamos reclutando un perfil **IA Engineer** para reforzar nuestro equipo en Madrid para trabajar en remoto.

**Lo que buscamos:**

* De 3 a 5 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos de IA, aprendizaje automático e IA generativa.
* Experiencia en lenguajes de programación como Python, R...
* Conocimiento profundo de frameworks de IA como TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit\-learn y modelos generativos como GPT, BERT o Stable Diffusion
* Experiencia en manipulación y procesamiento de datos con herramientas como Pandas, NumPy y SQL.
* Experiencia en la gestión y configuración de bases de datos vectoriales.
* Familiaridad con las arquitecturas de software y la implementación en la nube (AWS, GCP o Azure).
* Conocimiento de servicios de IA y ML a hiperescala (Amazon SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure Machine Learning, entre otros).
* Experiencia con MLOps y pipelines de automatización.
* Experiencia con tecnologías de contenedores como Docker y herramientas de orquestación de contenedores como Kubernetes.
* Experiencia con diferentes protocolos de comunicaciones como REST, API o MQTT.
* Sólida comprensión de las canalizaciones de CI/CD y los sistemas de control de versiones

**Lo que ofrecemos:**

* Flexibilidad en el régimen de trabajo (remoto);
* Participación en proyectos con tecnologías innovadoras y de dimensión internacional;
* Ambiente de trabajo dinámico;
* Formación continua en el puesto de trabajo;
* Remuneración acorde con la experiencia demostrada.


Si te identificas con este perfil, envíanos tu CV actualizado a recrutamento@movilges.com.


Si deseas obtener más información sobre nosotros:


El Grupo Movilges cuenta con más de 30 años de experiencia en el mercado español y portugués, especializada en Logística, Movilidad y soluciones IT. Ofrecemos servicios de consultoría, desarrollo de aplicaciones y mantenimiento de sistemas. Al igual que el universo tecnológico, en constante evolución, el Grupo Movilges busca evolucionar, aumentando su presencia en Portugal con Movilges IT Consulting, ofreciendo productos y servicios para la gestión completa en el ámbito IT, desde la Consultoría y el Gobierno, el desarrollo de aplicaciones con tecnología low\-code, el aseguramiento de la calidad software, hasta la automatización de pruebas y de procesos en Movilser Tech.


En Iberia, estamos presentes en diversos sectores, como retail, tecnología, salud, administración pública, energía, servicios, banca y seguros.


Al enviarnos tu candidatura, autorizas al Grupo Movilges a procesar tus datos personales, como nombre, correo electrónico, número de contacto e información sobre tus experiencias académicas y profesionales que constan en tu CV. El procesamiento de estos datos se realiza únicamente con fines legítimos de la empresa, es decir, para los procesos de reclutamiento de profesionales cualificados para nuestro equipo. Si tienes alguna pregunta relacionada con tus datos personales, puedes contactarnos a través del correo electrónico portugal@movilges.com.
